p: Because of the current COVID-19 pandemic, regular follow-up of already diagnosed patients can be delayed. These patients are not at an increased risk of contracting the infection and general disease prevention measures can be followed. If infected with SARS-CoV-2, plasma and urinary metanephrines can be elevated from the associated stress response and measurement during illness will give false-positive results [ 81]. During the infection, treatment via α-adrenoreceptor blockade, or β -adrenoreceptor blockade after adequate α -adrenoreceptor blockade, can be considered to prevent possible cardiovascular complications [ 82].
